intro: Kibara rigidifolia, commonly known as the rigid-leaved kibara, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its rigid, leathery leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. Kibara rigidifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
